content: serpent star afghan square by lettice rose i found this amazing little character in a welsh rock pool he was lying upside down and his underbelly was completely stark pure white so much so i thought it was a discarded plastic toy tutted and picked it up to put in a bin turning him over revealed the astonishing beauty of his body and alien looking blunt segmented legs they screamed bullions to me i took a photo and left him the right way up in peace i looked him up when i got home and discovered he was a serpent star and decided he must be immortalised in crochet there is an alternative version for those who don t like bullions but you will lose some of the essence of the creature so i urge you to try them there are many ways to form bullions demonstrated on the internet i favour a little piece of plastic drinking straw over the hook for the wraps but experiment to find what works for you serpent star copyright lettice rose 2024 measurements this design produces a standard 12 afghan square using a 5 mm hook and worsted yarn i used stylecraft special dk yarn and a 3 5 mm hook to produce a 9 25 square the final stitch count is 39 per side yarn a = tomato yarn b = stone yarn c = duck egg yarn d = storm yard e = khaki abbreviation single_crochet = single_crochet flo = front loop chain = chain st = stitch only skip = skip slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double blo = back crochet loop only pm = place marker half_double_crochet = half double decrease = single treble_crochet = treble crochet crochet 2 together crochet sc3tog = single decrease = double yo = yarn over crochet 3 together crochet 2 together special stitches spike single_crochet spsc insert hook in indicated place yo pull through and draw up to height of current round yo pull through 2 loops to finish stitch low front post treble lfptr used in round 6 stitching into round 5 instead of stitching around the post of the tacking double_crochet stitch around the two strands at the base of the stitch that are enclosing the round 3 chain serpent star copyright lettice rose 2024 bullion b followed by number of wraps wrap hook required number of times insert hook in indicated stitch yo pull through all loops on hook pull yarn to adjust yo pull through to lock narrow puff npuff yo insert hook in indicated stitch yo pull up loop x 2 yo pull through 4 loops yo pull through 2 loops special instructions there are several rounds using back loop stitches you will get a more stable square if you can take in the third loop at the same time finishing a round with an invisible join
